message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the development of a training strategy for convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for interactive segmentation editing. The paper focuses on the use of a robot-user during training to closely mimic realistic use cases to achieve optimal editing performance. This work is primarily related to computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it involves the development of a CNN-based model for segmentation editing. The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques for training the model, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of a robot-user during training also involves robotics (cs.RO). Finally, the paper involves the evaluation of the proposed method on medical images, which falls under the category of multimedia (cs.MM).
